name: Drunken Noodles (Pad Kee Mao)
description: Recipe video above. Spicy Thai Noodles, a popular Thai take-out dish from the streets of Thailand! Make sure you have all ingredients ready to toss into the wok as once you start cooking, things happen quickly! Spice level: moderate to high (it's SUPPOSED to be spicy!)
recipeIngredient: <val>2</val>  birds eye chilli or Thai chillies (deseeded, very finely chopped, Note 2)
<val>7</val> ounce / 200g  chicken thighs (cut into bite size pieces, breast ok too)
<val>1</val> cup Thai or Thai Holy Basil leaves (sub regular basil, Note 3)

recipeInstructions.text: Mix Sauce in a small bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix Sauce in a small bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in wok or large heavy based skillet over high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in wok or large heavy based skillet over high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add garlic and chilli and cook for 10 seconds. Don't inhale - the chilli will make you cough!
recipeInstructions.name: Add garlic and chilli and cook for 10 seconds. Don't inhale - the chilli will make you cough!

recipeInstructions.text: Add chicken and fish sauce, and fry until cooked, around 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chicken and fish sauce, and fry until cooked, around 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add green onion, noodles and sauce and cook for 1 minute until the sauce reduces and coats the noodles.
recipeInstructions.name: Add green onion, noodles and sauce and cook for 1 minute until the sauce reduces and coats the noodles.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from heat and immediately add basil, toss until just wilted, then serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from heat and immediately add basil, toss until just wilted, then serve immediately.
